subject: Draft and Recruitment (Sports)
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. has accused Texas A&M-Corpus Christi of nine rules violations, including use of ineligible players, recruiting violations in men’s basketball and lack of institutional control. It said that the violations, eight of them major, occurred mainly from 2004 to 2008 in men’s basketball, women’s volleyball and men’s tennis.
